tam.description: Global AI services market combined with startup funding and business automation tools. Based on $80B AI services market (McKinsey) + $40B startup ecosystem services (PitchBook) + $50B business process automation market (Gartner) - $70B overlap, leaving $120B total addressable market

sam.description: Segment of TAM consisting of startups and businesses actively seeking AI-powered solutions, specifically those with $1M+ annual revenue or Series A+ funding, and those in tech/innovation sectors
key_constraints: High competition from existing AI tools
Limited awareness of AI co-founder concept

som.description: Realistic market share assuming 6.7% capture over 5 years, considering competitive landscape, customer acquisition costs, and product differentiation in the AI co-founder space
assumptions: Competitive advantage through specialized startup expertise
Global expansion with focus on US/EU markets

key_trends: Rapid AI adoption in business operations
Increased demand for automation and productivity tools
Growing preference for AI-powered decision making
disruption_risks: Large tech companies entering AI co-founder space
Traditional consulting firms offering AI services
Rapidly evolving AI capabilities reducing differentiation
regulatory_factors: AI governance requirements in financial services
Intellectual property considerations for AI-generated content
market_dynamics.timing: Perfect timing due to $100B+ startup ecosystem demand, AI maturity reaching practical application level, and increasing business need for cost-effective innovation solutions
